Bullshit.
That was Patric on the motorcycle. we need to get out of here.
We’re not going anywhere.
Kee, Julian told you to trust me.

Theo looking out the side door. There’s a row of six cars parked in front of him. Two Fishes standing nearby. Activity in the barn. He steps out the door... SQUISH! Theo’s expression -- he forgot to get his shoes. He continues, moving quietly to car in front of him. He opens the door...
Through the windshield, Theo sees the Fishes up ahead. He reaches down to the hood release -- POOK! The hood pops open. The Fishes do not hear it.
Theo squatting, sneaking around to the front of the car. Lifting the hood quietly. Reaching in... YANKING OUT the distributor cap. He gently lets the hood down.
Theo repeating the operation. POOK! He opens the hood. He’s about to get out, when: Fish 2 returns from the barn, heading directly to the car his hands and coat bloody. Theo hunches on the car floor.
(to the nearby Fishes) Man, I don’t think he’s going to make it. Fish 2 reaches into the car, just above Theo’s head, feel for: a pack of cigarettes on the dash. (CONTINUED)
(continues) His bones are sticking out, no skin, no way to hold the blood in... Fish 2 snags the cigarettes, walking away.
(as he leaves) ++-and all that sand and dirt stuck in there, how are they ever gonna get that out? Hearing Fish 2 leave, Theo reaches over to the hood relea switch -- POOK!
Theo enters the side door. Kee and Miriam wait just insid
Let’s go.

Day about to break. It’s dark, and the clouds are bloody red. Theo peers out the side door: two Fishes are standing nea the front, trying to stay alert, trying to stay warn. Theo leads Kee and Miriam to the Vauxhaul, the first car parked in the row. Quietly opens the back door for Kee. S slips into the back, while Miriam slips into the front do They close the doors without shutting them.
Theo slips into the front seat, gently closing his door. Through the windshield: the Fishes have not noticed.
Okay... The key is in the ignition. Theo turns it -- HA-RUMPH! After the first spark, the engine dies. Through the windshield: 2 nearby Fishes REACT to the sput
(quietly) Shit! (CONTINUED)
Theo tries again -- HA-RUMPH! Nothing.
What happened?
Battery’s dead. Through the windshield: the Fishes start walking to the c
Mark? Theo releases the brake and pushes in the clutch -- the c starts rolling slowly down the steep muddy road. In the direction of the approaching Fishes.
Shut the doors! Miriam and Kee and Theo pull their doors shut. Miriam hit switch -- FWICK! The car doors lock.
Mark?
The Vauxhaul picking up a little speed, bouncing down the steep rutted road, heading right at the Fishes.
(shouting the alarm) Alert! Theo checks the speedometer: 5 mph.
Fish 5 stands in the muddy track, holding up his gun, pointing it at the oncoming car.
The car still coming. Fish 5 about to shoot...
Luke steps out of the door --
NO! DON’T SHOOT!  60.

Fish 5 looks confused, the car still coming at them. He lowers his gun. He and Fish 6 try stopping the car with their hands, but the weight and momentum of the car surpa their strength. They have to step aside. More Fishes come running from the barn. Patric tearing ou of the house.
The girl’s in the car! Don’t shoot!
Somebody get a car!
Fish 5 and 6 chase down the slow moving car, grabbing the doors, but they’re locked. Fish 5 sticks his hand through the half open window, trying to pull the car to a stop...
Kee punches the intruding hand, trying to break its grip, Fish 5 hangs on...
More Fishes join the chase. So does Patric, running down muddy road after the car... Two other Fishes head for the row of parked cars.
Kee bites the hand trying to pull back the car. Fish 5 yelps, releasing his grip, allowing the car to gain momen Fish 6 slips down in the mud.
Fish 2 steps’ from the car.
It won’t start!
Theo turns: they now have some distance from their pursue He checks the speedometer -- 10 mph.

‘ THEO Okay, okay, okay... Here we go... Theo shifts into 2nd gear, releases the clutch -- HA-RUMP The car shudders, but doesn’t start. He tries it again -- RUMPH! No success. And now the car is almost stopped. Kee looks out the back window: the Fishes are gaining.
They're coming! Theo lets out the clutch, allowing the car to start rolli down the hill.
{begging the car) Go, go, gO, go, go.... The Fishes getting closer. Patric is coming full speed, running faster than the rest.
At the row of cars, two Fishes push a 2nd car into motion As it picks up speed, both Fishes jump in, the momentum carrying them downhill...

They approach the end of the muddy track, one big ditch, right before it intersects the paved road. Speedometer: 9 mph. Theo shifts into 2nd gear, about to release the clutch, w he turns to see: Patric has caught up, running even with back bumper, gain
The 2nd car coming downhill picks up speed.
Theo can’t afford to slow down, letting the car keep roll Patric catching up, keeping pace, locating Theo, raising pistol. (CONTINUED)

(shouting) Got a shot! Got a clean shot! Theo in disbelief, Patric running alongside, about to sho him at close range, when Kee kicks open her door -- FWAR! Kee’s door hits Patric’s back, tripping him up, sen him tumbling, bouncing hard across the mud and rocks. The car headed right for the ditch --
Hold on -- !
The car crashes into the ditch, throwing up mud --
Theo, Kee and Miriam bounce with the impact...
The momentum carries the car through the ditch, flying up onto the paved road, where it bounces to a complete stop.
Theo looks back at Kee.
You okay?
Yeah, just go, go, go!
The Fishes still running down toward them. The 2nd car is coming fast, right at their Fishes’ backs...
Theo jumps out of the Vauxhual.
(to Miriam) You know how to push start a car? Miriam slides over to the driver's seat.
Just push, push! Theo runs to the back of his car. He’s wearing only socks He starts pushing. As the car starts picking up a little speed-- HA-RUMPH! Miriam releases the clutch. Stopping the car.
(annoyed) Wait till it goes faster! Theo looks back:
The Fishes part, making way for the fast coming 2nd car. Fish 2 doesn't get the message, still in front of the car
Move away, off the road -- Too late. The 2nd car runs down Fish 2, just as it SMASHE into the ditch, the momentum carrying it to:
The 2nd car bounces to a stop. Not 30 yards from Theo.
Theo is pushing for all he’s worth. His socks are bloody. The car picking up speed. He turns to see: The Fishes have jumped out of the 2nd car, running toward them, catching up...

(to Miriam) Now! Now! The car shudders, the reluctant engine hesitating a momen before -- VA-ROOM! The engine finally roars to life. The car now is pulling away from Theo. He turns: the Fish are gaining. One pulls out a gun, aiming... Miriam stops the car, 10 yards ahead, Theo gasping, tryin make it, Kee looking from the back window.
(seeing Kee) Don’t shoot! Behind them, more Fishes have reached the paved road, joi the chase. Theo reaches the car, the door opens from insi
Theo jumps in.
Go, gO, go, go! Miriam shifts it into gear, the car lurching forward. Through the back window, we see the Fishes receding. Behi them, the sun cracks the horizon, rising.
Now what?
I don’t know. Theo about to vomit, out of shape, out of air -- on the v of complete collapse.
What about Bexhill?

The Human Project sent a floating hospital. It's disguised as a fishing boat, but the cabin is equipped with the best surgical equipment, and the best doctors. It’s following the cod run. Yesterday was the rendezvous in Dover. The only other one is in Bexhill, tomorrow, until sunset.
“The Tomorrow.” (off his look) Name of the boat. Gonna be next to a buoy. With flashers. Theo still gasping air into his lungs, looks at Kee.
You all right?
Cheedo.  65.
The vauxhaul pulling off a small road near some woods.
Theo gets out of the car. He walks to the middle of the road, making sure nobody is there. Then he goes to the fa hedge by the trees. Lifting the bushes, moving them away.
The car crossing the narrow dirt track in the woods.

Through the windshield, we are approaching a house rigged with make-shift solar panels. Jasper’s house. EXT. JASPER’'S HOUSE -~ DAY The car parks in front, next to Jasper’s car. Theo climbs out. He goes to the front door and knocks.
Jasper. Hello? Theo opens the door.
Theo walks into the house.
Jasper? The house is a mess. Glasses and dirty plates, books left strewn around. He walks into:

From behind: Jasper on the sofa, his hand dangling lifele off the armrest... a bottle of pills spilled on the floor On Theo’s face, hesitantly approaching around the couch.. Jasper lays in peaceful repose, his long hair partially obscuring his face. The sack containing Janice's ashes on his lap, open, his other hand clutching some of the ashes Theo lets out a painful sigh. He leans to his old friend. Pushing the hair away from Jasper’s face, when -- (CONTINUED)
Jasper opens ‘his eyes.
Huh...? Theo reacts --
Fuck!
Fuck you! The two men share a look -- they nearly scared each other death. A hint of Jasper’s old mischief flashes in his fac
Amigo... But it fades away, and Jasper breaks down, sobbing. Theo leans down and hugs his old friend.
I can’t make it, Theo. I can’t make it without her... Theo holding Jasper. Kee and Miriam entering the room.

Jasper. Meet Kee. Theo swivels Jasper around. Jasper looking at Kee -- disbelief, recognition... awe. INT. JASPER‘S KITCHEN -- DAY Theo’s wretched feet soaking in a bucket of water. Jasper the stove, frying eggs.

.-.the blokes who started the great cathedrals knew bloody well they’d never see them finished. But they built them. You know why? The certainty. They had faith that the new generations would complete what they started. Lovely, isn’t it? Faith and certainty. Jasper looks at Kee, her feet propped up, munching biscui (CONTINUED)
Kee, your baby is the miracle the whole world has been praying for. Hallelujah, hosanna, shanti, shanti, shanti. Jasper delivers Kee a plateful of eggs.
We need to get to Bexhill.
How?
What about the border cop? The guy who runs your pot.
syd?
Could he get us over? All eyes on Theo.
Get him to arrest us. Like Foogies. We get deported into Bexhill. Jasper considers this.
Waaaaaaah! That's good, amigo! Deported like Foogies. I like it. Jasper looks at Kee.

Kee, everything is going to be quite groovy. The old man is young again. EXT. JASPER’S HOUSE -- DAY Miriam near the woods, doing Thai Chi exercises. INT. JASPER’S LIVING ROOM -- DAY Theo watches Miriam through the window, opening his flask Kee is laid out comfortably on the couch, her exposed bel propped on a pillow. A fire blazing in the chimney. (CONTINUED )
‘ KEE She doin’ her craze?
Hm? Theo sips from his flask.
Her flittin’.
(smiles) Uh huh.
She smited me with that. Said it was good for my baby. And my shockers.
Chakras.
Yeah. She look posh to you? Or gawky? Theo observes Miriam -- standing on one foot, the other hovering in the air, trying to keep her balance.
She looks earnest. Theo turns: Kee’s beautiful belly, lit softly by the firelight. He’s about to sip his flask, but stops.
How long have... how many months -- ?
Eight. (off his look) Takes nine months.
Ahum. Silence. The fire crackling.
And who’s the, who’s the --
(sharp) Father? That what you wanna know? (CONTINUED)
Uh huh.
Whiffet. I'ma virgin.
Huh?
Cha, be wicked, eh?
That it would. Theo smiles.

Fuck knows. Omar. Sammy. Phil. Most of them wankers don’t know their names. Did some for quid, some for drugs. Some... Fuck knows, I was horny. You know the cock’n bull. Theo doesn’t know, still holding his flask, not drinking.
Ahun. Through the window: Jasper walks out of the greenhouse, a small backpack around his shoulder.

When I started puking, thought I catch the pest. And I think -- “bitch, you are whoppingly fucked.” But then me belly start gettin’ big, and I think -- “this not big fart stuck in my belly!” No, this fuckin’ spooky. Never seen a pregnant woman. Nobody ever told me these things. But I knew. Got a baby in my tummy. Cheedo, eh?
Uh huh. From outside, they hear: “Huh! Huh! Huh!” Miriam exhaling loudly, a breathing exercise.
I feel like a freak. I was ‘barrassed. I was ’fraid. Didn‘t tell no body. I think about that Quietus thing. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )
*Sposed to be suave. Pretty music, treat you cheedo. (beat) Then the baby kicked. Kee breaks into a big smile, her mood now bright.

Whew! I feel him. Little bastard was ‘live. aAnd...I feel it. Me too. I was ‘live. (beat) Didn’t know what to do. Talked to me mate, he knew the Fishes. Told me they would help me. I met Julian. She was suave.
(smiles) She was suave. Theo considers a drink. Then closes his flask. Jasper wal in the door.
Rock ‘n roll.
Jasper with the backpack, leading the group up the hill through the woods, his house behind them. They are bundle in coats against the cold, Kee in a cloak that hides her pregnant belly. Theo stops.
No-man’s land. A cold steel jagged-tooth barbed wire fence cuts across t woods: “MILITARY ZONE. POSITIVELY NO TRESPASSING.”
No-man’s land? Jasper searches the fence.

The two mile zone around Bexhill, dear. Nobody's supposed to be in it. Makes it easy for the migra to bag Foogies that trying to escape from the camp. (finding it) Here. Jasper locates the spot: a cut in fence. (CONTINUED)
Old smuggling route. Jasper pulls back the barbed wire.
Theo, you go first. Theo steps through -~- RIP! His pant leg tears.
Shit.
Get the skin?
Nah.

Grab the other side. Your turn, Kee. EXT. WOODS (NO MAN’'S LAND) -- LATE AFTERNOON The light is fading. The group walking across a long clearing, nearing the end. Kee moving steadily with Theo’ help. Miriam has a fist full of wild flowers.
(to Theo) How’re the dogs?
Huh?
Your feet. Theo is wearing an old pair of boots.
(in pain) uh.
Almost there. (gestures) Other side of the hill. They arrive at the end of the clearing, at the woods. The in the silence -- WOOF! (CONTINUED)
There...
A GERMAN SHEPHERD howls the call for the hunt. Three more German Shepherds-come running from the woods, now running together in a pack. Running toward the group.
The group starts running toward the wooded area ahead.
Quick -- go!
The pack of dogs closing the gap.
The group keeps running. Miriam is in front, Theo at Kee’ side, helping her. Jasper looking over his shoulder.
How far?
We’re not going to make it.
The pack of dogs entering the trees.
Jasper stops.
(to Theo) Go! Take the girls! I'11 stay.
What? Theo stops.
I‘ll be fine, amigo. If I don’t move, they won't do much. Jasper tosses him the backpack. (CONTINUED)
Give this to Syd. Go to the road. He's patrolling at this time. When he stops, tell him I sent you. If he doesn’t believe you, tell him he’s a fascist pig! Theo hesitating.
Go! Miriam nearing the top of the hill, calling back:
Hurry! Theo starts running again, holding onto Kee.
Kee! Kee looks back. Jasper standing alone in the woods.
It’s going to be groovy! Kee smiles, Theo pulling her along. Miriam has reached th top of the hill.
Come ont
WOOF! WOOF! The pack of dogs running through the woods, drunk on their hunting instinct...
Jasper picks up a branch. Gets his grip. Holds his ground
(to himself) Goodbye, Ruby Tuesday, who could hang a name on you... Watching the pack of dogs charging...

Theo and Kee have made it to the top. He turns to see, barely visible at a distance, mostly obscured by trees:  74. IN THE TREES’ The first dog leaps at Jasper. He swings his branch, hitt the dog backwards. Immediately, the other three dogs attack, the victorious frenzy of the pack bringing down its prey.
Theo blocks Kee’s view of this, leading her to the other of the hill. Ahead of them, Miriam is nearing the road. They run to catch up.
Theo and Kee catch up to Miriam on the side of the road, An IMMIGRATION POLICE HUMVEE appears from around the curv bearing down, headlights shining on them.
Is that Syd?
I don‘t know.
What do we do? The SPOTLIGHT turns on, glaring on them...
Back, go back --= They start running back to the woods. The Humvee stops. A BORDER COP climbs out, pointing his gun.
The group is lit by the spotlight, just short of the wood
Stop, I'll shoot you. Theo stops with Kee, Miriam still running.
Stop -- stop! Miriam finally stops, the three of them standing still. Waiting. Panting. The rumbling of the Humvee engine. (CONTINUED)
And the footsteps of the Border Cop as he steps through t grass, approaching them, pointing his gun...
Let’s see your hands... They raise their hands, Theo holding up Jasper’s backpack
This is from Jasper --
Drop it!
Jasper said --
Drop it or I'1l shoot you! A beat.
You’re a fascist pig --
What did you say? The Border Cop advances, his gun point blank in Theo’s fa
What did you say?
You're a fascist pig. The Border Cop cracks a big smile.
The Humvee parked on the side of the road.
(laughs) .--that's what he used to call me, “corrupt fascist pig.” Last century, they used the word “fascist” a lot.
SYD (the Border Cop) sits up front, smoking a cigarette. 50’s, thick-bodied, life-long cop. He loves his mother bu would sell her for the right price. (CONTINUED)

syYD Wiggy old bastard. He was so proud of his weed. Always asking more than it was worth. JERRY -- pimply border cop, 30 -~ sits beside him. He pul a brick of marijuana out of the backpack and hands it to Theo, Kee and Miriam sit in back, behind metal meshing.
Could get the same shit - way cheaper - from the Zeds, but Syd liked buying from him. Straight chap, a true gentleman. God bless him. Kee MOANS with sudden pain. She shoots a look of alarm at Miriam.
What’s with the Zed? She sick?
Nothing. Miriam takes Kee’s hand, reassuring.
She’s not going to puke, is she?
Can‘t wash out puke. Smell never goes away -
She’s fine. At a distance, we see a BUS approaching.

Usually it’s people trying to get out of Bexhill, not in. Syd doesn’t know why you want to get in, Syd doesn’t wanna to know, Syd doesn’t care. When they release you, stroll out with the rest of the detainees. You'll see a statue of a soldier. Syd will contact Marichka. She’s an Arab, gypsy or something. Syd will tell her to meet you there. She’ll arrange fine accommodations for the evening. Syd opens the door. (CONTINUED )
You‘’re Foogies now. So show Syd a big sad face, come on, let’s see them... (show them a sad face) c'mon, sad Foogie face. And don’t speak English.
No such thing as an English foogie.
Jerry’s right. Through the window, a bus approaches down the road.
It's been Syd‘s privilege to serve you.
Syd gets out of the Humvee, raising his arms to stop the

head_text.subj: INSIDE THE BACK OF THE HUMVEE --

text: Theo looks at Kee with concern.
(to Miriam) Is she okay?
She had a contraction. (off his look) It’s normal. Syd opens their door.
All right, Foogies. Out! Move.

Theo slides out of the Humvee, helping Kee down, Miriam following. Walking to the “IMMIGRATION CONTROL” bus -- an old school bus, painted over, the windows covered with ba The driver is inside, an armed guard next to him. A steel cage behind the driver.
Go on, get in. Theo, Kee and Miriam step on:  78.

The steel cage door opens. Theo, Kee and Miriam step in. The cage door closes behind them. They start making their way down the aisle, looking for a seat. Forlorn, malnourished, desperate, trapped faces of captur refugees stare back at them. fhe bus lurches, driving forward. Kee moans with the sudd jolt. Theo steadies her. Miriam finds an empty seat.

Here. They help Kee into a seat, Miriam sitting by the window. Theo sits across the aisle. Through the window, he sees: and his Humvee, receding behind them. Theo feels a yank on his shirt. He turns: it’s a withered old COUPLE, filthy, pitiful, hungry. The Old Woman puts h fingers to her mouth, the universal plea for food, speaki in a language Theo cannot understand, probably German. Theo shrugs. He has nothing to offer.
The bus travelling along road. The lights of the city ahe
Kee reacts to a shooting pain.
(in pain) Uhh! Other refugees turn. Theo realizes they’re drawing attent
_ (whispers to Miriam) You sure this is normal?
(quietly) Shouldn't be this frequent. She’s only in her eight month. (to Kee) Breathe through them. Just breathe.
Can‘t fuckin’ breathe --
Theo looks outside: the bus stops at a Check Point illuminated with spotlights. One bus already ahead of the
Miriam... I’m all wet. Water drips down her leg, forming a tiny puddle on the fl
Her water broke. This baby’s coming.
She can’t have the baby now.
(glares at Theo) That’s very insightful. Kee reacts to the beginning of a new contraction.
(gritting) Uhhh...
Just breathe, sweetie. Everything is perfect. (to Theo) How long to get there?
They‘re checking a bus ahead of us.

Our bus is parked behind another bus. The Check Point is wired off with a major steel fence, trimmed with razor wi From the bus in front, Police violently yank off three refugees, vicious dogs barking at them.
Kee breathing through a contraction.
What’s going on?
I don't know. Theo looks to see: the Police pushing the three refugees, forcing them to their knees. The three refugees pleading. (CONTINUED )

Dogs barking, One of the Police hits a refugee with a rif butt. The man collapses. Another Police kicks the refugee The overhead lamps turn ON, shining harsh light. Kee is still breathing through her contraction. Two Policeman enter our bus. The lst Policeman is holding dog, walking slowly down the aisle, checking the faces of refugees. A 2nd Policeman follows. Some refugees react Kee’s labored breathing, looking back her. Theo and Miriam share a look of concern.
Shhh.... The ist Policeman glares at a Refugee, who averts his fac
Look up! (no response from Refugee) Look up, you shit! The 1st Policeman pulls the Refugee up by his hair.
Out! .

(pleading) Pieta’, pieta’, no, no, no, ti prego, un po’ di compassione... The 1st Policeman keeps walking. The 2nd Policeman yanks Refugee out of his seat, dragging by his hair to the fron the bus, pushing him off. The Refugee is shoved into the group of kneeling refugees. In the bus, the dog starts barking. Theo, Miriam and Kee tense, as the dog drags the lst Policeman forward. The do is in now front of Kee, barking at her, smelling somethin has never smelled before. The lst Policeman looks at Kee: she is breathing hard, clutching the tube of the seat in front of her, looking a the floor, in the middle of a contraction.
What’s wrong with her? Miriam is frozen. The dog barking. The Policeman yanks Ke up by her hair, twisting her face toward him. (CONTINUED)
(angry) I said, what’s wrong with her? Kee's contorted face, her eyes wide, wet, terrified.
{with an accent) Caca. The Policeman turns to Theo.
What?
Caca. Caca, piss. Theo points to the floor. The Policeman sees the puddle.
Caca, piss, girl, big mess. Smell!
(recoiling slightly) Smell it yourself. The Policeman yanks the leash, but the dog keeps barking Kee, not wanting to move.
(yanking harder) Snoopy. The Policeman walks past, heading off the bus. Miriam loo at Theo with relief.
The bus rumbles to life, lurching forward, heading throug steel fenced corridor...
Out the window, we see the corridor, fenced in steel, reinforced with razor wire, hopeless faces looking throug the gaps... The BEXHILL FENCE.
The bus is parked. Refugees pile out, guard dogs barking their heels. Theo and Miriam helping Kee down.
It‘s a chaos.of people. Guards wield night sticks, herdin the group to the final gate. Approaching the threshold, Theo sees a sign framing the g “ACCEPTANCE IS ENDURANCE”.

Theo, Kee and Miriam emerge from the gate, looking around disoriented, lost. This is Bexhill. What used to be an industrial port town now a sealed-off refugee camp, barely lit by occasional street lamps with uneven current. Kee suddenly stops, doubling up -- a new contraction. The flow of refugees keeps pushing behind them, pushing them forward, Kee stopping pain --
Miriam holding Kee for support.
(urgent) She‘’s about to deliver this baby. A man walking past, looking at them curiously. Pale skin, knit cap, hook nose. Theo sees: the statue of a soldier.

Wait here. Theo heads to the statue, a WWI soldier holding a bayonet rifle, charging. The plaque reads: “Lost Generation.” The walks around the pedestal. YAP! YAP! A tiny runt dog nips at his heels, scaring the hell out of him.
Shit... Theo turns to see a woman: MARICHKA. Olive skin, 40, the exhausted eyes of someone who accepts the hardship of lif fate. She knows when to duck.
Marichka?  83.

Theo helps Kee into a motorized rickshaw, Miriam already sitting in back. Marichka sits in front, wrapped in a old wool coat, the dog on her lap. Miriam looks back anxiously. Theo turns and sees the Hook Nosed man walking towards them.
You know him?

I might. Let's go. (to Marichka) Go! Marichka revs the rickshaw into motion. Through the back window: the Hook-Nosed man runs after them, but he can’t catch the accelerating rickshaw. He recedes behind them.
A few months ago, one of the Bexhill fences was blown up. A big group of Foogies stampeded through the hole.
I saw the news.
The Foogie escape was a only smoke screen. What we were actually doing was smuggling some of our people inside. To organize cells.
Smoke screen killed lots of Foogies.
I know, but it was Luke’s plan. He believed we needed strong cells in Bexhill. He called them missionaries.

The rickshaw crosses through the dark streets. Small, jur rigged plastic tents around the sidewalks. People warming their hands around scattered piles of burning rubbish -- watching suspiciously at the passing rickshaw.
Kee coming out of a painful contraction, Theo and Miriam supporting her on either side. Kee looks at Miriam.
This gonna hurt, yeh?
Yes.
The rickshaw parks in front of a building, trash piled ar the street. Marichka gets off, leading them into a doorwa The sounds of dogs howling and arguing in the night.
The dog hopping up the stairs, Marichka next, holding a butane lantern, leading them up the dark stairwell. Kee stops suddenly, holding herself against the wall, in pain
Breathe through it...
One more flight... Marichka starts prattling to them in a language they cann understand, possibly Romanian --
Come on sweetie, you have to make it. The baby is telling you he wants to come out.
Can she make it?
(defiant) She can make it. (CONTINUED)
The contraction passes. Kee nods. Theo and Miriam help he up the stairs.

The door opens. The little dog scampers inside, uses a ch as a springboard, leaps onto the table, and through the broken window yaps his presence to the dogs barking outsi Theo and Miriam help Kee into the room. Marichka sets the butane lamp on the table. The room is naked, peeling wall broken window panes, a rough mat on the floor. Cold enoug to see your breath. Miriam immediately pulls the mat to the center of the roo Kee doubles up with another contraction --
Fuck all! Marichka trying to explain something they cannot understa pointing at 2 BUCKETS of water, the dog yapping and yappi
(to Theo) Make her go. Miriam plucks a shard of glass from the broken window. Th goes to Marichka, turning her toward the door.

Thank you, Marichka, we appreciate your help... that‘ll be all... Kee holds herself on the table, moaning with the pain. Miriam dips the glass shard into the bucket -- breaking a thin layer of ice covering the water, cleaning the shard. Marichka turns, pointing at Kee, agitated, prattling on. Miriam gives Theo the glass shard.
Hold this. Get her out!
{escorting Marichka out) She’s fine, she’s fine, just ate something funny... Marichka is outside the door, taking out a candle.
Santo! (CONTINUED )
The little dog gets his final yap in, jumps off the table joining his master. Miriam helps Kee down onto the mat.
We're going to lay down now. Slowly. Kee kneels onto the mat with Miriam’s help.
Don’t push yet. Marichka lighting the candle, still talking as she starts down the stairs with Santo. Theo closes the door.
Give me your flask. Theo looks at her, confused.
Your flask, get your flask! Theo takes the flask from his pocket.
Open it. Still pinching the shard of glass, Theo unscrews the flas top. Miriam holds out her hands.
Pour. Theo pours the alcohol on Miriam’s hands. Kee moans in pa

(reassuring Kee -- and herself) This is it. Everything is fine. All we have to do is flow through it. Miriam dipping her hands into the bucket of water. ‘ MIRIAM (to Theo) Give me your shirt. Theo pulls off his coat, unbuttoning his shirt, still pinching the shard of glass. He hands Miriam his shirt.
Sterilize your hands. And the glass. (CONTINUED )
Theo takes a quick, small drink from his flask. Then pour the rest of the alcohol over his hands and the glass shar Miriam goes to Kee, who is laying on the mat, clutching, grabbing -- agony.
Miriam kneels by Kee’s legs, pushing away her dress, putt Theo’s shirt under her. Seeing:
She’s completely dilated. (to Theo) Hurry! Theo finishes cleaning his hands in the bucket.
(to Theo) Put the glass on the scarf. Get behind her. Kneel. Theo obeys, clumsy -- he has no idea what to do.
Her head -- take her head. (Theo complies) On your lap, let it rest. Kee screaming, in the throes...
Take her hands! Theo takes her hands, but Kee writhes, pulling them away.
Grab them! Theo takes Kee’s hands more forcefully.
I can’t ~- I can’t do this!
Trust your body. Your body knows what to do. Now push.
I can’t fucking do it!
Push.
Fuck you!
Push. Kee pushes -- her hot breath visible in the cold room.
Beautiful. Just like that. Keep breathing. Again. Now push. Harder. Kee pushes with all her might.
Good. Gather your strength. Grab him. Kee clutches Theo's hands harder -- although we can see h breath, she is covered in sweat.
Good job, Theo.
Ahum.
Push. Kee pushes -~ her breath visible.
Yes... That’s it, just like that. Again. Kee pushes -- a round object appears, emerging from blood the vagina expanding... Miriam witnesses this, utterly amazed...
Oh, Lord. There he is. Kee screams -- excruciating pain -- fear.
I can't! I can’t! I can’t!
All the women who have ever given birth are with you right now. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
They are with you Kee. (firm) Push. Kee pushes -- the head impossibly stretching open the vag coming through...
Push. Theo holding onto Kee, blown away.
(awkward) You’re doing great. Kee looks up at Theo, her face wet with sweat and tears, little reassured. Miriam watches: the baby’s blue head emerges completely..
The head’s out. My God, look at that. (urgent) Push, Kee.
Push. Kee pushing -- the rest of the baby’s body flowing out in stream of blood, Miriam supporting the emerging mass...
Here he comes, here he comes... Kee pushing mightily, Theo barely able to hold her hands
You're nearly there... Kee screaming her extraordinary effort, tapping the reser of female strength, giving her body over to the new life coming through it, to life itself, the miracle --

-- the baby bursts forth, a bloody explosion of life... Miriam pulling it free, still hooked by the umbilical cor the placenta spilling out in a final bloody exclamation ~ There is a moment, a pause. Theo holding Kee. Both of the looking to Miriam. (CONTINUED)

For the first time in eighteen years, four months, two da sixteen hours and eight minutes, a human child has been b Miriam holds the newborn baby, all blue, covered in white specks, giving off steam in the cold room.
It’s a girl.
How's my baby?
She’s perfect. Theo, come.
Lemme see her! Theo lays Kee back down on the mat. Moving to Miriam.
(gestures to her scarf) Take the glass. Theo takes the glass shard off the scarf.
cut it.
What?
The cord.
Where?
Here.
What‘s you doing? Gimme my baby!
In a moment. Theo hesitates with the glass shard.
It doesn’t hurt. Theo puts the glass against the umbilical cord and SLICES The cord splits, spurting a bit of blood. (CONTINUED)
Miriam yanks off one of her bracelets, gives it to Theo.
Tie it. Here. Any knot will do. Theo ties off the umbilical cord with the string bracelet
What’s wrong? She okay?
She’s beautiful. (to Theo) Get the shirt. Theo takes the shirt from under Kee and hands it to Miria She cleans the white, cheese-like residue from the baby. Theo watches, freaked out.
Scarf. Open it. Theo opens the scarf. Miriam expertly wraps the baby in i
Aren't they supposed to cry?
She‘ll cry. When she’s hungry. Now, she wants Mommy.
Fuckin ‘a. Miriam offers the wrapped baby to Kee. Theo returns to hi spot, supporting Kee from behind. Kee accepts her child, holding her, smiles.
Hey you...my boo, bloo...watch at you... The baby CRIES, a strident, rhythmic scream that shatters night. Theo looks at Miriam, alarmed.
Show her where your breast is. Kee puts the baby to her breast. Instinctively, the child suckles, extracting the milk hungrily. Kee watches, amaze
Cheedo, eh?  92.

A dim light shining from a window. Inside, Theo, Miriam a Kee ~~ beholding this new life. Surrounded by the black night. It's silent. Even the dogs have stopped barking. FADE OUT. The sound of distant HELICOPTERS... sporadic GUNSHOTS... blending with the sound of YAPPING, coming closer...

Theo opens his eyes, waking up on the floor, his coat pul over him, getting his bearings: The first morning sun finding its way into the naked room Kee still sleeping on the mat, the baby at her chest. Mir seated next to Kee, asleep. YAP! YAP! The tiny barking sound is now outside the door. Footsteps following. Theo creakily gets to his feet. There’s a PUSH on the door -~ but a chair is wedged again the handle inside, keeping it shut. A decisive knocking o the door, the YAPPING growing frantic... Kee and Miriam open their eyes, awakening.
(outside the door) Open the door! Kee and Miriam look to Theo.
(outside) We don’t have much time -- open the bloody door! A harder push on the door-- the chair slides, about to gi
Who is it? syYD It’s the Queen of England, can you spare a cup of sugar? It’s Syd, you fool. Open the door. (CONTINUED)
Miriam wraps the cloak around Kee, hiding the baby. More pushing on the door, the chair sliding...

Okay, okay... In the distance, a staccato burst of gunfire is heard. Theo takes away the chair, cracks the door. He peers into the hall: a man stands there, wearing nondescript clothes a turban -~ it takes moment to recognize Syd. Marichka behind him, Santo jumping, trying to get in the room.
Didn't know you were coming.

Didn’t you hear the bomb last night? The city’s gone to hell. Come on, let Syd in. Syd has already pushed through the door. Miriam holds Kee tighter. Santo is now running around inside, yelping. Marichka follows. Theo immediately closes the door. Syd looks at the residue from the night before: the blood mat, the bloody clothing... .
What’s with the Zed?
Nothing. She’s fine. Some woman’s thing. Santo is on the scent, sniffing at Kee, yelping.

A few hours ago one of the fences got blown up, and a group of Foogies escaped. It didn’t take long for other Foogies to follow, your regular stampede. The army came in, they’re trying to secure the fence. Just like five months ago, but worse. Now those Foogies are better organized, and Syd happens to know they’re armed to the teeth. It’s gonna be a fucking war out there. We got to get you out of here.
We need to get a boat. (CONTINUED)
Santo keeps yapping at Kee.

(to dog) Go on, piss off. Santo won't leave. Kee kicks him. Santo yelps, retreating Marichka starts yelling at Kee in some language. Then -- CRYING. From the baby. Rhythmic, loud. The dog comes charging again...
Get your fuckin’ dog! Kee kicks the dog again.
Santo! Marichka grabs her dog. The baby still crying loudly. Kee puts the baby to her breast. The baby calms, suckling.
The hell was that? Santo still yapping in Marichka’s arms. Marichka gives Sa a little slap, shutting the dog up. Quiet -- except for t moist suckling of the baby.
What is that?
I’1l explain --
What you got there? Let Syd see it.
Miriam eases, the cloak from Kee's shoulder. Revealing th BABY, suckling at Kee’s breast.
Bloody Christ. Marichka approaches. Kneeling, seeing the baby, amazed.
It’s a fucking baby. (CONTINUED )
We need a boat. Syd starts pacing.
(insists) We need it before sunset --

Hush! Hush! Syd’s trying to think here! Marichka reaches her finger. She looks to Kee, who nods h permission. Marichka touches the baby. Her face lights up her eyes well with tears ~~ she has touched a miracie.
Okay, okay... Get her up. We’ve got to go right now.
Can you get us a boat -- ?

Sure, sure, sure. Just get her up! Come on, do it! Theo moves to the mat. With her shawl, Miriam finishes securing the baby to Kee’s breast. Outside, another burst gunfire, closer. Together, they gently help Kee up. Marichka turns to Syd, talking at him, prattling on, adam
What’s she saying?
Fuck knows. Marichka turns to Theo, Miriam and Kee, prattling on, urg Syd pulls out a two-way radio.
{into radio) We're ready, Jerry.
Who's Jerry?
You met him. Pimply bloke. (CONTINUED)
Marichka insists, grabbing Syd’s sleeve, prattling on --
Shut up! (in Romanian) “Bastal” Syd throws Marichka off.
Let’s go.
Not (points to Syd) Bad! Bad, badi
She doesn’t want us to go. Syd pulls out a gun. Marichka instinctively ducks to the floor, covering her head, her hands pleading. syD Okay, move. Let’s go. The group is frozen.
Where are you taking us?
Syd said move! Miriam walks to the door, blocking it.
We're not leaving. We can’t leave, Syd. Not until the baby’s safety is guaranteed. A standoff. In the distance, mob shouts are heard.
Move!
I will not. BANG! Syd shoots Miriam in the head. She falls in the doorway, dead. (CONTINUED)
Kee lets out a wail of horror, her knees buckling. Theo holds her. Marichka still cowering.
(points his gun) Who’s next, the Yank or the gypsy? Maybe the fucking dog? BANG! Syd shoots the floor by Santo’s feet. The dog yelps scampering for Marichka’s protection. Kee glares at Syd.
(spits the words) You fuckin’ caca man. Syd points his gun at Theo’s forehead.
Move. Seeing no way out, Theo looks at Kee.
I’1l help you.
Marichka leads them, Theo carries Kee in his arms, Syd following with his gun. Marichka still prattling on.

Last night, Syd gets home, mommy's sleeping in front of the telly. She always does that, my sweet soul. Syd kisses her good-night. She has cancer, my mommy. Syd‘’s about to turn off the telly -- and there’s your mugs. On the news. You nasty pricks gunning down those cops -- bam! bam! Big reward. Marichka is ranting even louder, Santo yapping. ° SYD Shut the fuck up! {into radio) Jerry, you on your way?
(on radio) I had to go around a barricade. (CONTINUED)

(into radio) Just hurry the fuck up. (to Theo) Then Jerry calls Syd. The Fishes in Bexhill are looking for you. So Syd thinks, the cops are looking for them, the Fishes are looking for them, these blokes are bang-up commodities. And a baby? That‘’s capital. (into radio) Where the fuck are you, Jerry? The group arrives at the ground floor. Theo lets Kee down both resting on a cold radiator, catching their breath, Marichka next to them. Syd holds the gun on the them as the goes to entrance to investigate. The entrance has no doors, Marichka’s ricksh visible on the street outside. sYD (on radio) Where are you?
Syd, please, listen.
Shut up. Theo watches Syd, still pointing the gun behind him, but attention wavering to the street in front.
(on radio) I can see the building.

Good. Come around to the front -- Theo makes his move, charging across the lobby. Syd hears him coming, turns... Theo FALLS OVER a rusted pipe that saves his life -- BANG! Syd‘s shot just misses Theo’s head. Theo's fail carries him into Syd’s legs, knocking him backwards. Syd’s head bangs the floor, the radio flying.
Go! (CONTINUED)
Kee gets it. She clutches Marichka for support, pointing the front door. Marichka gets it, helping Kee to the door

(on radio) I'm here! I’m right out front. SMASH! An personnel carrier rolls up, crushing Marichka’s rickshaw. Marichka stops, reverses herself, helping Kee b across the lobby, passing Theo crawling toward Syd. Syd, coming out of his daze, trying to point his gun, but Theo reaches, grabbing his gun hand. Marichka helping Kee into a CORRIDOR at the end of the lo Theo on top of Syd, struggling with his hand, Syd biting Theo's head.

(screams) Abhhhh! Theo's hand forcing the gun away, pressuring the trigger BANG! BANG! BANG! The gun fires into the wall, plaster falling, until it the chamber CLICKS. CLICK. CLICK. Empty From the corridor, Marichka and Kee look back, reacting t the gunshots. Theo pushes Syd away, starting after the women. Syd grabs Theo's legs, tripping him, sending him thudding on the fl the gun sliding away. Syd jumps on Theo, punching his face. He puts his hands around Theo’s throat, squeezing. Theo gasping, reaching, strangling him. From the corridor, Kee urges Marichka back to help.

Go -- go help! Kee against the wall, loosening the scarf, checking her b Marichka reluctantly heading back to the lobby, staying l her hands defensive, prattling urgently, pleading to Syd. Syd keeps tightening his grip around Theo’s neck. Theo's body going slack. Marichka gets closer, still pleading.

Theo’s hand reaches to the gun on the floor, grabbing the barrel, round-housing it -- SMACK! -- into Syd’s face. Sy falls backwards, stunned. Theo pushes himself to his feet, gasping air back into th lungs. Syd recovering, moving toward Theo. Theo kicks Syd in the head. Syd falls backwards, knocked out. Theo, for good measure, kicks Syd in the gut. Theo grabs Marichka, gasping, motioning for them to leave They head down the corridor, joining Kee. They reach a door at the end. It’s blocked with boxes and junk. Theo and Marichka clearing the debris, Theo forcing the door open, just enough space to pass. Behind them:
Syd groggily crawls to his knees, looking for the gun.

Marichka snakes through the narrow door passage, out to a small alley, Santo following. It’s Kee’s turn, but there' not enough space for her to pass with the baby. From the alley, Marichka extends her hands.
Baby, Marichka! Kee hesitates, Theo pulling the door open. Behind them:
Syd finds the gun.
Kee passes the baby through the doorway, fearing the wors Marichka takes the baby. The point of no return. A moment Marichka motions for Kee to follow.
Come! Ree squeezes through the opening. Theo still holding the door, looking back:
Syd stumbling toward them, gun in hand, loading bullets.  101.

Theo trying to squeeze out, but nobody is helping with th door -- BANG! Syd‘s shot misses, leaving a hole in the metal door Theo throws his body into the door, forcing it open -- BANG! BANG! Shots ripping the door as Theo squeezes throu
Theo comes out the door into the trash-strewn alley. Kee Marichka waiting, Kee wrapping the scarf, covering the ba to her chest.
(to the women) Go. They start making their way slowly down the alley, Marich holding Kee up. Theo is about to follow, when he hears:

(into radio) Jerry, they got loose... go to the back, the alley... Theo realizes Syd is too close. They aren’t going to make it. He looks around, rooting through the trash, desperate Worthless plastic, rotting food, a rusted CLOTHES IRON.

(into radio) I don’t know, Syd, this is getting bad. I got a 1-24, a gang of frogs in the streets, they’ve got guns, we ought to get out of here... Syd’s face appears at the door. They look at each other f an instant. Syd furiously forcing his way through -- Theo grabs the clothes iron and swings -- CRANK! Into Syd’s face. Syd falls back inside the door. Theo stands, staring at the door, the iron poised, ready. But he quickly understands there’s no need to wait. Theo drops the iron, and rushes after the women.  102.

head_text.subj: AT THE END OF THE ALLEY -

text: Kee leaning against the wall, gathering her strength, Marichka peering around the edge of the building. Theo arrives, completely winded. “La Marseilles” can be heard, chanted by an approaching mob.
You okay?
It hurts. I’m hungry.
(to Marichka, re: Kee) She needs to eat. Marichka prattles some sort of answer. Theo puts his fing to his mouth, the universal sign of hunger.

Food, mange... (points to Kee) Hungry. Marichka nods, getting it, pointing. Theo and Marichka ta on either side of Kee, helping her walk, Santo following. They round the corner onto the street. Pocked and rubbled the streets of Bexhill bear scars of previous violence. A mob marches toward them, more than 50, a large flag billows, blue, white and red.
Alons enfants de la patrie... Theo and Kee and Marichka passing the mob in the opposite direction. Passionate chanting, some wearing masks, all carry guns -- modern semi-automatics, a few old Glocks.

This street seems quiet, “La Marseilles” now distant. Marichka, gestures, leading them into a bureaucratic buil covered with graffiti. Further down the street, on buildi tops, men with rifles run from roof to roof.
Theo, Kee and the baby, Marichka and Santo enter. Dozens old shoes on the floor, neatly paired. They hear CHANTING rhythmic prayers.

It was once a bank, but now just the skeleton remains, a teller counters, some bars along the lobby. Through them: Men kneel on a carpeted floor, bowing toward Mecca in hum prayer. This is a makeshift mosque. They pass by, moving to the stairs at the end of the hall

At the end of the dark corridor, Marichka is bent down at Metal door, talking to someone through a low eye-slit. A tiny flashlight shines through the slit into her face. A trembly voice on the other side of the door, in Russian:

Nyet . At the stairs, foggy light oozes though the filthy window Kee rests on Theo, discerning Marichka across the dark corridor, now waving for them to come, insisting, prattli Theo helps Kee into the dark corridor.

Nyet, nyet... As they approach the secure metal door, the flashlight fr the eye slit shines in Theo’s face. Marichka grabs Kee’s cloak. The light shifts to Kee’s fac as she resists, but the cloak opens. The light tilts down shining on the baby, eyes closed, feeding on Kee’s breast From the eye-slit, the flashlight shaking, a gasp.

A pale, withered GEORGIAN WOMAN (87) hums a folk song as carves the final touches onto an orange that she’s cut in swan. She presents the swan to Kee, who lays in bed eatin some sort of potato stew, the baby asleep at her side.

Watch at that. They’re in a simple dwelling that was once a bureaucrat’s office. One table, two chairs, a gas burner, photos, a Chagal reproduction of the cow on the farm. And, in the clean, big windows, a few potted plants, green, living.
Check it out, Theo. They love my baby. (CONTINUED)

Theo sits at the table, eating stew. Marichka stands near wolfing hers -- she hasn’t eaten this good in awhile. The ancient, dignified GEORGIAN MAN (90’s) sits in a wheelcha speaking in a trembly voice with thick accent.
Human Project, is real?
Yeh. Wise man doctors from todo the world. Living in Iceland. Sent a boat to my baby. “The Tomorrow”. At the buoy.
We need a boat to meet it. Before sunset. The Georgian Man asks Marichka a question in her language Marichka answers by rubbing her thumb to her fingers, the universal sign for money. .
(mouthful of stew) “Bunch of money.”
(in Marichka’s language) “Yeah, yeah, yeah...” The Georgian Man wheels himself toward the bookshelf. Marichka looks at Theo, rubbing her thumb to her fingers.
“Bunch of money.” The Georgian Man arrives at the bookshelf, where pantheon busts reside: Lenin, Freud, Einstein, Ghandi, Trotsky, Zapata, and Martin Luther King, Jr. He selects Lenin.
(to Theo) Always money. Everything always money. Seeing the owners distracted, Marichka nabs a silver spoo from the table and sneaks it into her shirt. An amplified voice echoes from the street.
A curfew is now in effect. Theo looks:  105.
A caravan of armored personal carriers and tanks move slo down the empty streets.

(over loudspeaker) Anyone seen on the streets will. be considered hostile and shot. England supports you and provides you shelter. Do not support terrorists. Then the same message, translated into French. On top of building across the street, men in masks armed with rifle run in the opposite direction of the tanks. KEE’S VOICE Watch at that! Watch at Santo and the pussy.
RUFF! Santo barks. HISS! The cat arches. Kee laughs.
Get it on! The Georgian Man rolls back in his wheelchair to the tabl holding the bust of Lenin.
We hear Human Project, no believe. Trick, make people hope. (smiles) But is real! The remains of the smile on the old man’s lips as he look his wife, telling her something in Russian. Then:
Human Project!
(smiles) Human Project. Marichka nods, laughs, pretending like she understands.
Human Project! The Georgian Man BREAKS Lenin’s bust on the table. In the porcelain shards: a roll of money. English pounds.  106.

Marichka stands in the middle of the street, her senses alert. Sporadic gunfire and shouting in the distance, but the street seems safe. She signals, and starts trotting. Theo immediately pushes Kee from the bank in the Georgian Man’s wheelchair. Kee has the baby wrapped against her ch and covered. She’s holding the orange cut like a swan.

The group in the middle of a street obscured in fog, Theo pushing Kee in the wheelchair, trying to keep up with Marichka’s quick trot, Santo tapping along. A RUMBLING in the street. Santo stops, turns around, and starts barking. The ground begins to shake. They all turn: the street beh them shrouded in fog. Street poles shaking. A mechanical clacking adds to the rumbling, drowning out Santo’s barks Through the fog...a silhouette slowly taking form...mammo

Shit... The silhouette defines itself as the fog gives way... A TANK. Solid, massive, scary. And it’s damn close, comin right on them. Theo pushes Kee, the group running away from the tank. Marichka looks back: Santo holds his ground, barking at the metal monster. Marichka turns, running back for her dog.
Marichka...! The tank getting bigger, Santo loses his courage, whimper backing off... Marichka grabs the dog. She turns, finding her stride, running back towards the others, trying to catch up...
Theo and Kee come against: a long metal pole wedged in a sewer, fortified by a big mountain of broken concrete and debris blocking the street -- a barricade.
Theo turns the wheelchair, veering off towards:
As soon as Theo and Kee take refuge --

(in Basque) “Down! Down!” They turn: a man with a machine gun is yelling at them. T are surrounded by other men -- some masked, all of them a -- more guns than the previous mobs. Marichka makes it to the alley, chastising Santo --
“Get down!” Marichka sizes the situation, and immediately drops to th ground.

The tank rolls by, followed by two Armored Personnel Carriers. A metallic CREAK! The tank runs up against the metal barricade pole that holds its ground. A moment. Silence. Just the idling of the tank motor.
The Basque men lay in wait.
A change of gear -- CREAK! The tank pushes against the barricade pole. The two metal arms wrestling, the tank confident, but the barricade pole will not back down.
The Basque Man signals --
“Now! Now!” The Basque men surge toward the street.  108.
More men surge forward, dragging over the carcass of a bu out car, blocking the way. A flaming bottle hurled froma building explodes against the tank. The ambush is on.
Theo gets to his feet.
We've gotta move. Theo rolls Kee forward, the baby secure against her chest following Marichka. Behind them, through the alley:
The carrier doors fly open, soldiers streaming out, screaming, shooting... The fog soon obscures the battle, but not the sound of carnage.

KNOCK! KNOCK! Marichka’s hand pounds a weathered door. An eye-slit opens. A man with an extremely pale face, matted hair and wispy whiskers stares out -- the SEWER RAT. The Sewer Rat assesses Theo and Kee as Marichka prattles her language, negotiating. She reaches into her shirt, pulling out the bills that used to be live in Lenin’s hea waving them.
3 armored carriers cruise by, disappearing into the fog. The coast clear, the Sewer Rat leads Theo and Kee and Marichka onto the street.

Don‘t move! Don’t move! Theo recognizes a man crossing toward them. The Hook-Nose Man. Coming at them, pointing a gun. Marichka immediately drops into her submissive position, the Sewer Rat raises hands. The Hook-Nosed Man whistles -- shrill, distinctive Three masked, armed men come running toward the group. On talking into a radio. (CONTINUED)

Wharf Street! Now! The armed men surround them. The leader takes his mask of It's Patric. He looks at Theo -- THUD! Patric rifle butts Theo in the gut, knocking him to the ground. Two Fishes holding guns on Kee, Marichka and the Sewer Ra

You teenie prick Patric son of the ugliest rotten whore may the devil keep on fist fuckin’ her in hell! A dozen heavily armed men come running from different directions, converging on Theo, Kee and Marichka and the Sewer Rat. Among them, Luke and Ian. Luke approaches Kee.
Are you okay?
Fuck you.
You‘1l be protected.
(still on the ground) We need to get to a boat.
(to the others} Let’s go. One Fish takes Kee’s wheelchair, another Fish flanking, hustling her away. Luke looks at Theo, Marichka and the Sewer Rat.
(to Patric) Finish them. Luke follows Kee and the Fishes. Patric cocks his pistol. Marichka still on her knees, outstretching her hands...
“Please, please, please...” Patric points the gun at Theo -- BAM! BAM! Shots ring out.  110.
An armored carrier rolls toward them, two soldiers shooti from the turret.
Patric retrains his pistol at the soldiers -- BAM! BAM! H open fires. The other Fishes follow suit, a fierce burst gunfire that forces the armored carrier to stop.
Let's go. Ian, hold them off. Luke and Patric run to catch up with Kee.
Soldiers climb out of the armored carrier, firing rounds.
Ian flanked by two men, holding position from behind a doorway. Two other Fishes take a spot across the street. Firing all they’ve got at the carrier. Theo scrambles away from the line of fire.
Theo ducks into a doorway with Marichka, clutching Santo, Sewer Rat following. Theo watches:
Luke and his men pushing Kee, rounding the CORNER onto 3r STREET, escaping the line of fire.
The street trembles, the poles shaking. The armored carri pulls to the side... Allowing a TANK to pass by. Shielding a group of soldiers, firing on Ian and his men.
The heavy barrage forces Ian and his men to retreat. Two Fishes make it to the corner. (CONTINUED)
1li.

Ian and the other two are flushed into open, crossing the street towards the corner -- TAT-TAT-TAT-TAT. Soldier’s gunfire cuts down two of the Fishes. Ian keeps running, swarming bullets smashing concrete. He makes it to the corner. Behind him:
Luke and the other Fishes fleeing.
Theo watching Kee being rolled away. He turns to the Sewe Rat and Marichka, who is crouched in a protective positio
Stay. Understand? (using his hands) You stay. You wait. Here. Understand?
(nods) Marichka, stay. Theo looks to his left:
Ian holding the position with two men, shooting, unable t stop the advancing tank.
(to the men) Go! The two men peel off after Luke. Ian fires a few more rounds, then follows.
Theo looks to his right:
The tank advancing, the soldiers marching, holding fire, their weapons trained on the corner, focused.
Theo sucks it up, gathering his courage. He storms out. (CONTINUED)
Ahhhhhbh!
Theo screaming his way into the open.
’ Ahhbhhhhh!
The soldiers, their focus on the corner broken by the screaming man, are caught off guard, a double-take before reacting, firing away.
Theo screaming his way across, bullets ricochet and crash making it to:
Theo shields himself against the wall, catching his breat He looks towards:
Ian and his men chase after Luke and the Fishes fleeing w Kee.
Theo sucks a breath, and runs after them.
Ian notices Theo running behind. He stops and shoots at h Theo twists away, running for cover, diving behind a stoo
An armored carrier emerges from the fog, cutting off the Fishes’ escape. They stop. Ian stops shooting at Theo, running to catch up.
The tank making the turn.  113.
Pinched between the Carrier and the tank, Luke gestures, leading Kee and the Fishes towards the modern apartment b in front of them. Ian catching up.
Theo gets up, starts running after the Fishes.
Soldiers climbing out of the carrier, shooting at Luke an the Fishes pushing Kee’s wheelchair.
Luke, and the Fishes make it the building, hoisting the wheelchair up the few stairs, rolling her inside.
The tank making it around. The soldiers follow. As they g a clear shot --

TAT-TAT-TAT-TAT! One of Ian’s men is shot in the back. Theo halts, veering back, running towards a burned-out do decker, abandoned on the sidewalk across the street from apartment block. He dives through the back door, knocking away the cardboard.

Theo falls on top of people huddled inside. Spanish screa of fear as bodies scramble away. Theo gets to his feet. He’s just crashed into a densely packed living quarter, makeshift mats crammed across the a burner in the middle. People crouching for cover, a few peering through the cardboard covering the windows.
